title: Teams 2 MQTT schema
description: JSON schema that defines the settings for the Teams2Mqtt service

logLevel.description: Configures the log level of an item

LogLevel.description: The configuration of the log level

mqttLoggingEnabled.description: If enabled, the MQTTnet client will also log messages. The output depends on the additional logging configuration performed for the .NET logging library. Default value is false.

server.description: The MQTT broker to connect to

username.description: The username to use for authentication with the MQTT broker

password.description: The password to use for authentication with the MQTT broker

homeAssistantAutodiscoveryTopic.description: The prefix of the topic to use for MQTT auto discovery by Home Assistant. The default value is "homeassistant". See https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/mqtt/#mqtt-discovery for further information.

removeDevicesOnShutdown.description: If enabled, the devices will be removed from Home Assistant when the service is stopped. Default value is false.

deviceSuggestedArea.description: The suggested area for the created device in Home Assistant.

sensorLocalizations.description: Defines the localized/custom names for the sensors

sensorId.description: The unique identifier of the sensor

sensorName.description: The localized name of the sensor

configuration.description: The general configuration for the application

teamsWebSocketAddress.description: The address of the Teams Web Socket endpoint. This is normally "127.0.0.1" or "localhost". The default value is "localhost".

teamsWebSocketPort.description: The port of the Teams Web Socket endpoint. The default value is 8124.

teamsReconnectInterval.description: The interval in seconds to wait before trying to reconnect to the Teams Web Socket endpoint. The default value is 10.

refreshInterval.description: The interval in seconds to wait before refreshing the state of the sensors. The default value is 30 seconds.
